data.title: A piece of the past
data.text: First time at this location since the Provo location closed.  We have been coming to El Azteca since the parents had it near BYU.  Not quite the same but so much better than the other fast food Mexican restaurants.  Tacos are still amazing as well as nachos.  Their bean soup is the best ever!  Miss the salsa bar.  Trust us and grab a bag of cinnamon chips.  Also some of the friends from Provo now work here.  We will be coming back more often!

data.title: Love This Place
data.text: We've been eating here for years. The food is great and the owners are nice. Love the crispy chicken tacos!!! Taco Tuesday $1.75 ea.

data.title: Best Taco Shop Around
data.text: They are very nice here, with great service. The food is excellent. We usually call in the order and go through the drive-thru. Don't waste your money at chain taco restaurants - go here.

data.title: Wasn't very tasty.
data.text: They didn't serve any salsa or chips and if you wanted some, you had to pay for them.  The enchiladas were tasteless and hardly had any stuffing in them.The tacos were just average.  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

data.title: I absolutely love 2 things here
data.text: I haven't tried too manny things on their menu, because overtime I go I enjoy their beef taco combination plate(hard shell). It is to dye for if you like a good authentic taco these are for you. the other thing I love is their tres leche cake. It was the first place I ever had it and it's great.

data.title: Great food, huge portions!
data.text: Have eaten here many times, and the problem is always "What to get today..." I agree with other positive reviews, the beans are great, chicken and beef dishes are very tasty and satisfying. If you are really hungry try the nachos - I have never been able to finish a plate. Today I had the chicken nachos, got a little more than half way and was stuffed. Dinner tonight was awesome too as I finished it off!  Price has gone up a bit for the combo plates - almost $10, but they are a full meal.

data.title: Long-time Provo/Orem Mexican tradition
data.text: Excellent and typical Mexican menu. Above average for semi-fast Mexican food. You won't go wrong with this place, at several locations.

data.title: Best tacos and nachos in town
data.text: We have loved the food at El Azteca for decades. The hard shelled tacos are the best. Nachos is generous and great. I love the hot sauce bar especially the spicy pickled carrots. I always go for the sweet mild sauce. The chips and salsa's are homemade. The employees are friendly and helpful. Love this place.

data.title: Love it
data.text: This place has the best chicken tacos! They have a delicious salsa bar. The customer service is great. It's also always very clean.

data.title: Good food and service
data.text: We had arrived for a night stay in Orem on our way to Grand Teton and had come from Bryce Canyon.  Found this place and the food was good and they were friendly asked where we were from, Scottish accent, and recommended going to Sundance, which is what we did the next morning, fantastic place.  Friendly, excellent food and prices!

data.title: Great Mexican food--FAST
data.text: This is run by the same people that used to have El Azteca by BYU.  The food is great and quick.  They even have a drive through.  We like to stop there when we are in a hurry.

data.title: just nasty
data.text: I have really liked chili rellenos in the past, but I may not be able to order this dish again after the one I got here.  I am sure that I am permanently put off them for a long time.  The dish served with beans and rice was just wrong.   very soggy and sloppily served.  I should have ordered the fish tocas that my wife had, but there again the the food was sloppy and falling apart as she ate.   won't be back of course

data.title: Quality, good tasting food
data.text: Not every restaurant has the menu items you wll find here.  I have eaten almost everything they serve.  Mole made from scratch, like everrything else is wonderful.  I love the items from their salsa bar.  They can do mild to spicy.  The salads and greens are always fresh.  If you want to experience fresh made mexican food from scratch, then this is the place to visit.

data.title: here eat this mess
data.text: Everything served here seems like it was all smashed together. Weird stringy meats and limpid shredded lettuce.

data.title: The Best Mexican Food in Utah Valley - Great Salsa Bar
data.text: I've been going here for years, including the old restaurant before it closed down.  The finest mexican food around.  Everything is made fresh.  Their refried beans are the best I have ever had - in Utah or out.  They are made fresh daily.  Shredded chicken dishes are incredible, as are their shredded beef.  Some favorites - tacos - come in 2 fried hard shells, taco salad, tostada, carne asada platter, carne asada burrito, bean and cheese burrito smothered in green sauce (with pork).  Try the bean soup - it's delicious.  This was the first Mexican food restaurant chain in Utah Valley and the only one for a long time.  This local family knows how to cook.  Get to know them - they are also wonderful people.  Salsa bar is one of the highlights!  They have several items at the self-serve salsa bar - great traditional salsas and several other styles.  Chips and salsa is very good.  If you want the best Mexican food around, try this out.

data.title: Best Mexican in Utah County
data.text: The original El Azteca was opened as a sit down restaurant just south of BYU in the 1950s, but closed in the 1990s.  This place serves the same quality food on styrofoam plates with plastic utensils at a good price.  Their chips and salsa are famous for a reason.  The whole family loves to go there for anything they make.

data.title: One of our favorite little joints
data.text: El Azteca has been a favorite of my family for years. It's cheap, authentic and delicious. They have a fresh salsa bar which I always enjoy. They also have a drive through, and it sure beats Taco Bell down the street. Yum!

data.title: My favorite Mexican Restaurant!
data.text: I have never gotten anything to eat at El Azteca that I haven't loved.  Almost tacky atmosphere, but kind of fun at that.  We go so often the people that work there know us.  (We go at least a couple of times a month). Great chips and DELICIOUS sauces - you can choose from many.  It is self serve and certainly not fancy, but really good, homemade type food.  We love it!

data.title: DELICIOUS, AMAZING, AND AWESOME FOOD
data.text: If you're looking for some excellent Mexican food, El Azteca is the place. It is not crowded, therefore you NEVER have to wait in line or for your food. It is a reasonable price. It has an AWESOME salsa bar. ALL the food tastes delicious. Also, they have really good chips.

data.title: To get a good taco in Utah County this is the place to go.
data.text: The food is flavorful and fresh. The prices are reasonable. This is the first place I think of when I am in the mood for a good taco.
